page.title: 18MARYC.LOCAL HISTORY TEMPLARS
page.content: The greater part of the land here belonged from 1187-1548 to the Knights Templar. These were men of noble birth pledged to escort Christian pilgrims. They vowed obedience, chastity, poverty. They wore a white cloak adorned with an 8 pointed red cross to remind them of the 8 Beatitudes. After becoming too powerful they were abolished by the Pope. The Templars had a Preceptory in Maryculter and traces of their presence are seen in local place names. Some rare plants, said to have been used by them as medicines have been found.They took great care of their estates: monks supervised the farming. Each tenant had a portion of different soils so that no one would have totally bad land. Their standard of living was higher than usual for those times.
